title: In Search Of Truth
opening: Eliwood enters Santaruz, only to be attacked by a strange group. In a desperate moment, he is rescued by a childhood friend, Marquess Ostia's younger brother, Hector. The assailants' leader reveals that an unknown party seeks Eliwood's head...Eliwood cannot help but think this is related to his father's disappearance. In search of more traces of his father's footsteps, Eliwood sets out for the castle of Lord Helman, the marquess of Santaruz.

Hector rescues Eliwood, and the two friends are reunited. The paladin Marcus reveals news: Someone has called for Eliwood's death. Pherae's problems must be connected to the attempt on Eliwood's life. Searching for more clues, Hector and friends depart for the castle of Marquess Santaruz.

intro.speaker: Helman
intro.line: Master Ephidel! What is the meaning of this?

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: Peace, Lord Helman. Whatever is wrong?

intro.speaker: Helman
intro.line: You said you were just going to frighten Eliwood! Your men almost killed him! My patience is at an end! I've decided I must tell Eliwood everything and apologize.

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: .......You would betray us?

intro.speaker: Helman
intro.line: I am tired of you and the Black Fang! Now, remove yourself from my castle! Your presence pains me!

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: Lord Helman... Is there nothing I can do to change your mind?

intro.speaker: Helman
intro.line: Nothing.

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: In that case...you're no longer of any use.

intro.speaker: Helman
intro.line: Gaa...urrgh...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: There's the castle, Eliwood! Hm? Who's there? Show yourself!

intro.speaker: Boies
intro.line: Pah! Can't believe I was spotted by a snot-nosed stripling...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Who are you? No, never mind. Keep your name. Why should I care what a corpse is called?

intro.speaker: Boies
intro.line: The cub thinks he's a wolf! Does your bite match your bark? Tell you what. If you make it to the castle alive, we'll find out, eh? Geh heh heh hehhh!

intro.speaker: Mercenary
intro.line: Hey, you! Yeah, the new dog! Get this right, or you're gone!

intro.speaker: Guy
intro.line: I know, I know. I just got this job! I don't want to lose it!

intro.speaker: Guy
intro.line: 'Course, the smart thing to do would have been not to get involved with this ugly bunch. Got to have gold if I want to eat, though. I was too picky before. If I think about the time I passed out in Caelin... Ooooh. Nothing funny about that! That man... What was his name... Matthew? If it hadn't been for him, I would've starved to death...

intro.speaker: Mercenary
intro.line: What are you mumbling about? Get over here now!

intro.speaker: Guy
intro.line: Yes, yes, I'm coming! At least I've got work!

intro.speaker: Lowen
intro.line: Nice to be working with you, Mark! As a journeyman knight of Pherae, I'm here to serve Lord Eliwood and you, Mark! I await your command!

intro.speaker: Matthew
intro.line: Say, Mark. Not sure how to say this... You're a full-blown tactician now, aren't you? Not just an apprentice like before. Ha ha... No need to be so modest. My lord tactician! I humbly await your no-doubt brilliant orders!

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthew
recruit-talk.line: Hold on! You! I know you! Isn’t your name Guy?

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthew
recruit-talk.line: What a pleasant surprise! How’s your swordwork coming?

recruit-talk.speaker: Guy
recruit-talk.line: You are aware this isn’t the best place to be catching up, aren’t you? You and I…We’re on opposite sides here.

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthew
recruit-talk.line: What? Are you saying you’re going to fight me?

recruit-talk.speaker: Guy
recruit-talk.line: I…Well, yeah. I’m much improved. You can’t beat me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthew
recruit-talk.line: You’re quite a terror, Guy. Well then… Hold on! I’d prefer it if you repaid what you owe me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthew
recruit-talk.line: Last time I saw you, I gave you food.  If I remember correctly, you said you owed me your life.

recruit-talk.speaker: Guy
recruit-talk.line: I only said that ’cause you said you’d feed me if I did! I hadn’t eaten in ten days, and you were cooking meat! You… This… This isn’t fair!

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthew
recruit-talk.line: The people of Sacae never lie. Isn’t that right, Guy?

recruit-talk.speaker: Guy
recruit-talk.line: Grrr… Fine! I finally find work, and now I have to throw it away! This is all your fault!

boss.speaker: Boies
boss.line: What’s this? You’ve made it this far? Ah, I paid too much for that worthless pack of sellswords!

boss.speaker: Boies
boss.line: You’ve beaten me…but you’re too late to save him… Too…too bad, eh, laddie? Geha ha…geha!

end.speaker: Helman
end.line: I… I must apologize… Your father… He…

end.speaker: Helman
end.line: I… … If I hadn’t told Elbert…about…Darin’s plans…This would…never…have…Cough cough…

end.speaker: Helman
end.line: …..Go to Laus…Darin…the marquess of Laus…knows all.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: It can’t be…Lord Helman…Why……Why did this happen?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: …..We go to Laus. We must speak to the marquess of Laus, Lord Darin.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: You’re right. We should leave quickly. I’m not sure how far we can get today, but…I can’t sit still.

end.speaker: Servant
end.line: I’m the steward of Santaruz. With our lord gone, what are we to do?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: First, you give Lord Helman a proper burial. After that…I’m sure the Lycian Council will have to meet. Stay here and defend the castle until you hear more.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Let’s go. We must keep moving.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Yes…and now we seek answers for Marquess Santaruz, too.
